Angus Innes
Hi! I'm Angus, a full stack web developer with a background in Economics and Marketing.
I am currently based in London, and have recently completed the Web Development Immersive course at General Assembly.

  • About
  • Work
  • Skills
About

In 2014 I graduated from Newcastle University with a 2:1 degree in Economics and Business Management.

I was fascinated by Financial and Behavioural Economics but I left University wanting to build pragmatic skills and broader life experience.
As a consequence of this I worked and travelled extensively in Australia and India. Working in a solar energy company in Bangalore with Economists and Engineers I found myself drawn to the latter. I soon decided I wanted to create things and have a career that would use my social skills but be defined by a technical ability.

This is what led me to the General Assembly course and I am confident it was the right decision.
I love the problem solving aspect and build process of development and continue to marvel at the infinite angles of approach when finding a solution.

I now look forward to my first job in the Industry and to working in a challenging team environment.
Work
Danny Fox’s Wild West
Shoot ‘em up with a twist


Project 1 on WDI was to build a front-end game using HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery. Inspired by a Cornish Artist and Aladdin on Sega MegaDrive, I made an animated 2 player game.

Cabin Collective
Crowd-sourcing collective build projects


Project 2 was to build a password-protected Ruby on Rails app with a SQL database. I made a build-project version of Kickstarter inspired by a love of the outdoors and the maker movement.

The Forum
Examining the power of online-communities and long-form content


Project 3 was a group project to build an app with a Node.js API, a NoSQL database and a jQuery/AJAX front-end. We paid homage to Reddit.


  • Project Link

Real Talk
Redefining the floor of the political debate


Project 4 was to build a full-stack app with a framework and tools of our choice. I made an open chat app specific to the Houses-of-Parliament with a Node.js API, a MongoDB database and an Angular front-end.
